item.title: Ferrari 250 GTO
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:74, topic:328309”][quote author=mwiebelhaus link=topic=424702.msg3204707#msg3204707 date=1273694305]
In all fairness:

300C- 28,010 U.S. dollars
599 GTO- 406,368 U.S. dollars
[/quote]

Exactly. So you spend 10,000 more (probably less) US dollars on the engine in the 300C, and it would wipe the floor with the 400k Ferrari. That to me shows the American car is far superior, since you can get better results for less than 10% of the price of the alternative.[/quote]

Are you just completely retarded or just slightly?

item.title: Ferrari 250 GTO
item.dc:creator: @eVokki1 Cowie`
item.description:
@eVokki1 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:70, topic:328309”][quote author=Cowie` link=topic=424702.msg3204437#msg3204437 date=1273664373]

PS: Take a 300 and a Ferrarri and hell even put them on a straight line and see who wins, ignorant faggot.

Yes, because taking a $300,000 dollar car and comparing it head on to a $30,000 car is totally fair. :rolleyes:

That being said, there is a good chance a SRT8 300 would beat that Ferrari in a straight line, it may even beat it on a track. 430 HP and 430 ft-lbs of torque stock. Spend another $7,000 on a twin turbo kit and bump that up to 700HP and 700 ft-lbs of torque and for $37,000 you just beat the hell out of a $300,000 Ferrari, go ahead and laugh at the idiot who is driving the other car, you earned it.

I know right, slam on a turbo which wont kick in for a good two seconds after you put your foot down in your 1.68963158 tonne vehicle and you’ll definately beat that Ferrari which would be 200m infront of you.

You could rebuild the engine to give you 700HP naturally aspirated too rather easily. But when you have 400+ ft-lbs of torque you don’t need anything from the turbo at the low end to help you get started like a tiny motor would.

It’s funny that you think you could move that 1.6 tonne quicker than a ferrari could move off the start, especially since a 250 from the 60’s were hitting 300 bhp and 330 ft-lbs torque standard.
[/quote]

Low-end torque is what you need to start moving something from a stop quicker, and the only way to get low-end torque is to have a big cubic inch engine, which means that the American car always wins from a stop with an engine like that.[/quote]

Ok I’ll say it like this.

300c - 430 ft-lbs torque.
599 GTO - 475 ft-lbs torque.

300c - 0-60 in low end 5 seconds.
599 GTO - 0-60 in low end 3 seconds.

Read full topic

item.title: Ferrari 250 GTO
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:69, topic:328309”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=424702.msg3204158#msg3204158 date=1273622626]

PS: Take a 300 and a Ferrarri and hell even put them on a straight line and see who wins, ignorant faggot.

Yes, because taking a $300,000 dollar car and comparing it head on to a $30,000 car is totally fair. :rolleyes:

That being said, there is a good chance a SRT8 300 would beat that Ferrari in a straight line, it may even beat it on a track. 430 HP and 430 ft-lbs of torque stock. Spend another $7,000 on a twin turbo kit and bump that up to 700HP and 700 ft-lbs of torque and for $37,000 you just beat the hell out of a $300,000 Ferrari, go ahead and laugh at the idiot who is driving the other car, you earned it.

I know right, slam on a turbo which wont kick in for a good two seconds after you put your foot down in your 1.68963158 tonne vehicle and you’ll definately beat that Ferrari which would be 200m infront of you.

You could rebuild the engine to give you 700HP naturally aspirated too rather easily. But when you have 400+ ft-lbs of torque you don’t need anything from the turbo at the low end to help you get started like a tiny motor would.
[/quote]

It’s funny that you think you could move that 1.6 tonne quicker than a ferrari could move off the start, especially since a 250 from the 60’s were hitting 300 bhp and 330 ft-lbs torque standard.[/quote]

Low-end torque is what you need to start moving something from a stop quicker, and the only way to get low-end torque is to have a big cubic inch engine, which means that the American car always wins from a stop with an engine like that.

Read full topic

You could rebuild the engine to give you 700HP naturally aspirated too rather easily. But when you have 400+ ft-lbs of torque you don’t need anything from the turbo at the low end to help you get started like a tiny motor would.[/quote]

It’s funny that you think you could move that 1.6 tonne quicker than a ferrari could move off the start, especially since a 250 from the 60’s were hitting 300 bhp and 330 ft-lbs torque standard.

item.title: Ferrari 250 GTO
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Black 2005 Acura MDX Touring, US

• 3,471 cc 3.5 liters V 6 front engine with 89 mm bore, 93 mm stroke, 10 compression ratio, overhead cam, variable valve timing/camshaft and four valves per cylinder
• Premium unleaded fuel 91
• Fuel economy EPA highway (mpg): 23 and EPA city (mpg): 17
• Multi-point injection fuel system
• 20.3 gallon main premium unleaded fuel tank
• Power: 198 kW , 265 HP SAE @ 5,800 rpm; 253 ft lb , 343 Nm @ 3,500 rpm

Photobucket

Matt Wiebelhaus's Library

View the full album on Photobucket.
